page.title: 19Kidderminster Police Station
page.content: {Simon (aged 11) wrote this report on {his visit to the Police Station. } I started noticing things as soon as we arrived. First the{Coat of Arms above the door, it consisted of three symbols, a{lion}representing {Herefordshire, three pears}for {Worcestershire}and a{leopard's head for{Shropshire. We were shown around by{Inspector {Burrett.}He showed us a{truncheon and a pair of{hand-cuffs,}then took us into the yard to see the cars.There was a{Patrol}car, a{Panda}car and a {Personnel Carrier}as well as the {motorbikes. In the{Operations Room}there was the {computer}and the{teleprinter}as well as a{close-circuit T.V.}screen. There were{cameras}on both the front and back doors. Finally we were shown the {cells}and the{detention rooms.
